titleStmt.title: A duke and no duke as it is acted by Their Majesties servants : to which is now added, a preface concerning farce : with an account of the personæ and larvæ, &c. of the ancient theatre / by N. Tate ...
titleStmt.author: Tate, Nahum, 1652-1715.
Lady.
Person of quality.
Etherege, George, Sir, 1635?-1691.
Cokain, Aston, Sir, 1608-1684. Trappolin creduto principe.
Draghi, Giovanni Battista, ca. 1640-1708. Tell me no more I am deceiv'd.
King, Robert, fl. 1676-1728. Ah, poor Olinda.
Draghi, Giovanni Battista, ca. 1640-1708. Who can resist my Celia's charms?

notesStmt.note: Three songs at end: "A song written by Sir George Etheridge, and set to music by Signior Baptist", "A song written by a lady, and set to music by Mr. King", "A song written by a person of quality, and set to music by Signior Baptist".
An alteration of Cokayne's Trappolin creduto principe.
Reproduction of original in Huntington Library.
